dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, did you catch the news about Jeff Bezos's trip to India? Big pledges being made.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, did you catch the news about Jeff Bezos's trip to India? Big pledges being made.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025. The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! The one where he, like, promised ten billion dollars in Made In India exports by 2025? That's, um, a pretty huge number!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! The one where he, like, promised ten billion dollars in Made In India exports by twenty twenty five? That's, um, a pretty huge number!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But, apparently, it wasn't exactly met with, you know, thunderous applause. More like... silence from the hosts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But, apparently, it wasn't exactly met with, you know, thunderous applause. More like... silence from the hosts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Silence? Really? I mean, that's a massive economic commitment. What's, uh, what's going on there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Silence? Really? I mean, that's a massive economic commitment. What's, uh, what's going on there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, for starters, India's antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for things like predatory pricing and preferential listings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, for starters, India's antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for things like predatory pricing and preferential listings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, I remember hearing about that. And then there's the government, too, right? Like, they're actually tightening e-commerce rules, specifically to protect local businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, I remember hearing about that. And then there's the government, too, right? Like, they're actually tightening e-commerce rules, specifically to protect local businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! [overlaps] And get this, a trade organization even organized protests in 300 cities across the country during his visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And get this, a trade organization even organized protests in three hundred cities across the country during his visit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wow. So, he's facing some serious headwinds then. But I saw him, like, posting videos from the Taj Mahal and flying kites. Was that his, uh, attempt at diplomacy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, he's facing some serious headwinds then. But I saw him, like, posting videos from the Taj Mahal and flying kites. Was that his, uh, attempt at diplomacy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He was really trying to, you know, show goodwill. And then he made these huge statements, like, "the 21st century is going to be the Indian century."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He was really trying to, you know, show goodwill. And then he made these huge statements, like, the twenty first century is going to be the Indian century.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Indian century? And the alliance between India and the US, "the world's oldest democracy and the world's largest autocracy"? That's a pretty, um, bold claim to make.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Indian century? And the alliance between India and the U S, the world's oldest democracy and the world's largest autocracy? That's a pretty, um, bold claim to make.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United Statesthe worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he took a bow after it! But you have to wonder, is this all, uh, landing well, especially with Prime Minister Modi's goal to make India a five-trillion-dollar economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he took a bow after it! But you have to wonder, is this all, uh, landing well, especially with Prime Minister Modi's goal to make India a five-trillion-dollar economy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos then took a bow. ... Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's tricky, isn't it? Because on one hand, you have Bezos trying to, like, charm his way in, but on the other, India seems pretty determined to protect its own domestic players.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's tricky, isn't it? Because on one hand, you have Bezos trying to, like, charm his way in, but on the other, India seems pretty determined to protect its own domestic players.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It feels like a very, uh, complex dance between global commerce and national interests playing out right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It feels like a very, uh, complex dance between global commerce and national interests playing out right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. A lot more going on than just a big export pledge, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. A lot more going on than just a big export pledge, you know?
